alert.note: Alert for Western Albany; Western Schenectady (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 4:37PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Clusters of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Schenectady, northwestern Albany, northern Schoharie and south central Montgomery Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 436 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking clusters of strong thunderstorms 7 miles southeast of Cherry Valley, or 10 miles west of Cobleskill, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cobleskill, Duanesburg, Berne, Middleburgh, Summit, Schoharie, Richmondville, Sharon Springs, Delanson, Central Bridge, Knox, Carlisle, Sharon, Seward, Esperance, Duane, Zeh Corners, Beekman Corners, West Richmondville and Rockwell Corners. This includes Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for eastern and east central New York.
